So. Buffy. I'm a huge fan. Some of you may know that, and those of you who don't know it now.
But I think that next season they won't call the show "Buffy", but instead "Skinny." 
You know, first I watched it was like, "wow. Sarah Michelle Gellar is so tiny." But then it was, "Wow. I can't believe that Michelle Tratchenberg (formerly of Pete and Pete fame) is even tinier." And now with the new slayer-maybe (ironically enough named Amanda) we are introduced to new levels of skinny. The running joke at my house is that if you put a wooden cap on her head, you could just use her to stake many vampires at once.
haha, Buffy humor.
They killed off Tara, the only girl who looked like she wasn't starving, although certainly she wasn't a large girl or anything. And no, she didn't die of a heart attack. So now I watch it and I just want to visit Sunnydale and cook them all big meal. Maybe they look at me and just want to take me to the gym. But still, so much of the skinny.

I have decided that if your ribs protrude further than your breasts, it is not a good sign. I guess for me the intersting part was the variety of body types. Queen Latifah had a pretty sexy song and dance number, and Catherine Zeta Jones (whom I do not find attractive nor do I think is "bigger" had a lot of "sexy" parts. She's built kind of broad, but definitely is thin. Sadly compared next to Renne Zelleweger she looked like Marilyn Monroe. Zelleweger had a tragically adolescent boy looking body.), but also the skeleton girls were prominently featured. And a lot of people inbetween. Which I guess is cool and much better than only skeleton girls.

I dunno. I'm tired and kinda sick. Spent the weekend at my mother's house. It was mostly uneventful. I want it to be tomorrow so I can buy new pants. I need them.

With desperation.

So this week I rented Blue Velvet and Mulholland Drive.
And is it just me, or do you feel like you're reliving the same traumatic experience with David Lynch every time you watch one of his movies? I just feel like ugh.. get some new tricks.
Or some new imagery.
Or something.
Please.
I mean, good and evil is one of the most common themes in everything everywhere. But he uses pairing like James Conrad- you know, 2 per page-like it's going out of style or something.
If I see one more David Lynch bit about a blonde and a burnette girl, one good and one evil (although which is which varies sometimes even in the same movie) I'm going to track him down, slap him, and tell him to find some new material.
It's gotten so bad that Mulholland Drive was just boring. The most exciting/intense part of the film was realizing that perhaps Billy Ray Cirus has a cameo, mullet and all. It was not scary or creepy or a departure from oh.. say.. ANY film he's done in the past.
I mean, I think that Twin Peaks may have been his best work, and that was a collaboration.
Whew. Now that my David Lynch rant is over...

So let's talk about aliens.
Yes, without a doubt, aliens exist. I mean, if you just consider the number of other galaxies and space in space.. they just have to. Probability is on that side.
However
I do not believe that aliens repeatedly visit earth to abduct farmer bob.
I mean, let's look at this as logically as we can. If there really are superior beings flying around in saucers, why are they all coming to earth all the time? Don't they have other places to be? And especially why are they all coming to earth to abduct our local farmers and hicks? I mean, if these great smart beings have the technology to fly here in a saucer, how many times do they need to abduct our locals to conduct elaborate experiments on our idiots? I mean, how many semen samples/anal probes need to happen before a creature smart enough to fly here in a saucer can understand a human body?

Eye color contagious

A smile can separate
Like milk and cream or
Sand and seashells
Hold spread apart
With angry hungry hands
Who act clumsy
Hold spread apart
To bridge a gap
Wider than a jungle
Brighter than a forest fire
Older than me
And no more true
Than anything
Ever thought and spoken
Maybe seen
The action  untoward
Hold
Spread apart
Then a cold ache
To let go
Of
Eye color catching
Across a room
Into a curled smile
In this imaged moment
Maybe I could learn
How to like the work
If I
Can penetrate
Into you.

...maybe I've been a bit ridiculous. A bit over-zealous. A bit anti-war obsessed.

Before I was channeling my energies into anger at our American Blood Lust and Blood Debt (which really I am still utterly disgusted and angry about. And I've been kind of angry at "we will not forget."
Like okay mother fuckers, that's funny. Cause when it's anyone but you, all you do is forget.
Like as long as we're remembering shit, let's take it all the way and remember the poeple that America has killed. How many people died in a Rawandan genocide when Clinton ok'd withdrawing UN troops and the world looked on.
But anyway. I'm all pissed off.
What I mean is just that I guess I've kind of overlooked the American loss. I've been too angry to feel sad about our end of it directly.
The situation as whole makes me feel completely despairing.
So I just wanted to post this and say that um.. yeah. That sucks for America a lot too.
I'm still not watching any patriotic bullshit tonight. And I'm still incrediblely pissed off at every single fucking American who supports the war.
But yes, our loss counts too.
Lives are lives kids. Here or overseas.
